Articles.Content: I have made one main world with many things, such as stations and landers. I would like to see what you have =D Here are a few pictures of what I have.
I mostly have lots of things in Kerbin Orbit. Mostly unmanned. Two space stations, and one isn't being used. I also have two probes in solar orbit.
Ahh nice. Got any pics?

I had a bunch of missions that went to other planets, but they have all concluded. All I have up right now is my Karmony Space Station.

From my recent Eve mission..
Holy cow, Nice station. Musta' taken you days to put together!
I got MCPV,two satellites,one prode at duna and another prode orbiting the mun,a space station. Thats all

So much debris you can't pick the space station to dock to correctly.

But I do have many Apollo style Mun landings stuck on the Mun, only 1/10 of the brave Kerbals came back.

, only 1/10 of the brave Kerbals came back.

Poor Kerbals =( Anyways nice to see them creations.

Easiest just to link to my steam profile:

http://steamcommunity.com/id/finis0/screenshots/

Easiest just to link to my steam profile:

http://steamcommunity.com/id/finis0/screenshots/

Woah, nice work there! It would be cool to land on duna. I've never been there yet. Lol

hey everyone im fairly new to this site and thought id just get stuck in start posting. ive made an imgur of all the projects i have going on right now if your interested, you can also use my designs if you like the look of them http://imgur.com/a/Qe0bF

Thanks. Working on getting the rover pictured toward the end up to my Munar base for the boys to play around in. But still flips over too easily.

edit: and Duna so far is my favorite world. Far enough away it's a challenge still (for my anyway) but not so far that it feels like omghard (like Jool and Laythe feel to me) Plus I really like the red planet feel . I like Mars stuff. A lot.
I agree, I like duna too. Also you have any advice on how to get a 66x jumbo fuel tank in space without using any of its fuel> (all I really need is the amount of fuel it takes.)

Holy cow, Nice station. Musta' taken you days to put together!

Hehe, thanks.... it took about a week of casual playing, about 9 different launches and docking procedures involved. I use it for orbital refuelling and crew storage/swapping. Kind of like a meeting point for all missions intended for anything beyond Kerbin orbit.
Nice. YOur creation inspired me to make a station. But for now I will make a mun base at same time
I once left a NERVA and a bunch of fuel on Minmus, after attempting to land on my transfer stage. Still, nothing exploded, and the lander on top got home safely.
Cool. Wait did you send the lander to explode the fuel? Or just tried to do it on a side task? anyways nice work.

hey everyone im fairly new to this site and thought id just get stuck in start posting. ive made an imgur of all the projects i have going on right now if your interested, you can also use my designs if you like the look of them http://imgur.com/a/Qe0bF

Nice pics! I like the station, but I kinda think the moon lander was a bit.... small.

Cool. Wait did you send the lander to explode the fuel? Or just tried to do it on a side task? anyways nice work.

I sent the lander, but had tons of extra fuel in the transfer stage, so i decided to try and land on that. Unfortunately I was overloaded and in darkness at the landing, and it took a suicide burn to make sure that the lander on top would survive. Amazingly, the ASAS and capsule torque managed to keep it upright as it fell over, still pointing straight up, with the NERVA sort of acting as a pivot as it fell. If you want, I have screenshots at the post Desbree Goes to Minmus:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/36102-Desbree-Goes-to-Minmus%21

I sent the lander, but had tons of extra fuel in the transfer stage, so i decided to try and land on that. Unfortunately I was overloaded and in darkness at the landing, and it took a suicide burn to make sure that the lander on top would survive. Amazingly, the ASAS and capsule torque managed to keep it upright as it fell over, still pointing straight up, with the NERVA sort of acting as a pivot as it fell. If you want, I have screenshots at the post Desbree Goes to Minmus:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/36102-Desbree-Goes-to-Minmus%21

Woah, Nice ship and story you have on that post. Now I do understand what you where doing lol. I find it funny that the ship survived and did not tip over.

I started a new save with 0.20. I currently have fuel depots around Kerbin, Mun and Duna. I have a base on the Mun and Minmus - Duna is next.

I'd post pictures, but am currently overseas for a work trip. My end goal is a flag on every body, and base on every easily returnable body, meaning not on Eve and Tylo at least initially.

A Cassini-Huygens replica about Jool, the IKRS (International Kerbal Rest Stop) The ELS-L landed on Eve (last we heard of it, it's probably been repeatedly crushed and dissolved) the ELS-C orbiting Eve, multiple landers on Duna, a few Mun rovers, a Kethane scanner orbiting the Mun, a failed Mun mission orbiting the Mun and various historical replicas of probes.
Wow, Nice work you all. Musta been hard to go to other planets.

Wow, Nice work you all. Musta been hard to go to other planets.

It's not so hard. First time yes, but once you understand how to do it, it's just time consuming. Getting to Moho is hard, because of the delta-v requirement, and I've frequently put probes in a Kerbol orbit while going there, because I ran out of fuel. The challenge is to get that extra delta-v (fuel) on the ship, or tighten your piloting skills to save fuel.
Yea I get it. But What I plan on doing is putting together a ship in orbit to fly to other planets. But right now I want to goto the mun a bit more.
